title: Brexit will be the casualty of another bitter Tory civil war
text:
After David Cameron’s botched plan to settle his party's European divisions 'once and for all' with a referendum, and Theresa May snatching defeat from the jaws of victory with a bizarre election strategy and 'halfway house' deal many thought worse than remaining, the party seemed, finally, to have got its act together.

In choosing Boris Johnson, party members selected a leader whose strategy exposed to the electorate that many ‘moderate’ Tories were in fact uncompromising Remainers and that parliament itself, not Brussels, was the true obstacle to Brexit. The Conservatives had even begun to reverse the flow of eurosceptic support towards the Brexit Party.

This week, having pointed out that the...
description: After David Cameron’s botched plan to settle his party's European divisions 'once and for all' with a referendum, and Theresa May snatching defeat from the jaws of victory with a bizarre election strategy and 'halfway house' deal many thought worse than remaining, the party seemed, finally, to have got its act together.
